definitions: being consumed by flames or undergoing combustion actively
extremely hot or causing a sensation of intense heat
characterized by passionate intensity or strong emotional feeling
requiring immediate attention or action due to critical importance
examples: The burning building collapsed after firefighters evacuated everyone
Burning logs crackled warmly in the stone fireplace
The burning sand made walking barefoot completely impossible
Her burning fever worried the doctors throughout the night
He spoke with burning passion about social justice reform
Their burning desire for success drove them forward relentlessly
The burning question dominated every discussion at the conference
This burning issue requires our immediate and focused attention

definitions: polished by rubbing to produce a smooth lustrous surface
made sophisticated or refined through repeated practice or experience
examples: The burnished copper kettle gleamed in the morning sunlight
His burnished armor reflected the torches around the hall
Years of practice had burnished her diplomatic skills considerably
The burnished prose showed decades of writing experience clearly

definitions: damaged, charred, or destroyed by fire or excessive heat
cooked too long resulting in blackening or unpleasant taste
emotionally depleted from stress, overwork, or intense experiences
examples: The burnt remains of the house stood stark against the sky
Burnt papers littered the floor after the office fire
The burnt toast filled the kitchen with acrid smoke
Nobody wanted to eat the burnt edges of the roast
She felt completely burnt after months of non-stop work
The burnt-out employees desperately needed a long vacation

definitions: covered with or full of prickly seed cases or plant parts
having a rough or prickly texture similar to burrs
examples: The burry wool required careful cleaning before it could be processed
His burry coat picked up seeds during the nature walk
The burry texture of the fabric irritated her sensitive skin
The plant's burry stems made it difficult to handle

definitions: relating to wild, uncultivated land or remote rural areas
of inferior quality or amateurish; not meeting professional standards
examples: The bush pilot flew supplies to remote Arctic communities
Bush medicine relies on traditional plant-based healing methods
That was a pretty bush league mistake for a professional
The bush repair job wouldn't last through the winter

definitions: growing thickly with many branches or strands spreading outward
having characteristics similar to a bush in appearance or form
examples: His bushy eyebrows nearly covered his eyes when he frowned
The squirrel's bushy tail helped it balance on branches
The bushy plant blocked most of the garden pathway completely
Her bushy hair required special conditioner to manage properly

definitions: broken, damaged, or no longer functioning properly
having lost all money or declared bankruptcy financially
examples: The bust television sat useless in the garage corner
Our bust air conditioner made the summer heat unbearable
After the crash, several major banks went completely bust
The bust company left hundreds of employees without jobs

definitions: broken, cracked, or no longer working as intended
caught in the act of wrongdoing or breaking rules
arrested or apprehended by law enforcement authorities
examples: The busted headlight made night driving extremely dangerous
Her busted phone screen made texting nearly impossible
He got busted cheating on the final examination yesterday
The kids were busted sneaking into the movie theater
The busted drug dealers faced serious federal charges immediately
Three suspects were busted in the early morning raid

definitions: full of energetic and noisy activity or movement
moving busily and energetically with purpose or excitement
examples: The bustling marketplace overflowed with vendors and eager shoppers
Tokyo's bustling streets never seem to sleep or rest
Workers were bustling around preparing for the grand opening
The bustling kitchen staff prepared hundreds of meals nightly

definitions: actively engaged in work or purposeful activity continuously
full of activity, movement, or things happening simultaneously
having too many visual elements creating a cluttered appearance
examples: The busy executive barely had time for lunch today
She's too busy with exams to join us tonight
The busy intersection required a new traffic light system
Saturday mornings at the market are always incredibly busy
The busy wallpaper pattern made the small room feel cramped
Her busy design included too many conflicting colors everywhere

definitions: having a masculine appearance or manner, especially of women
displaying traditional masculine qualities of toughness and strength
examples: Her butch style challenged traditional gender presentation norms completely
The butch haircut suited her confident personality perfectly well
His butch demeanor masked a surprisingly gentle nature underneath
The butch attitude didn't match his actual sensitive character

definitions: containing, covered with, or tasting strongly of butter
having a smooth, soft texture similar to butter
having a pale yellow color resembling fresh butter
examples: The buttery croissants melted deliciously in our mouths
This buttery sauce needs less salt but more herbs
Her buttery voice soothed the crying child to sleep
The buttery leather seats felt luxurious against our skin
The buttery light of dawn filled the eastern sky
She chose a buttery shade for the nursery walls

definitions: closed or fastened using buttons as the method of closure
emotionally reserved, formal, or unwilling to express feelings openly
examples: His buttoned coat protected him from the bitter wind
The buttoned collar looked too formal for the party
Her buttoned personality made forming friendships quite difficult
The buttoned executive rarely showed any personal emotions publicly

definitions: supported by architectural buttresses or similar structural elements
strengthened, reinforced, or supported by additional evidence or arguments
examples: The buttressed walls of the cathedral stood for centuries
The buttressed tower could withstand powerful earthquake forces
Her argument was buttressed by extensive research data findings
The buttressed proposal gained unanimous board approval yesterday evening

definitions: producing a continuous humming or vibrating sound
filled with excitement, activity, or animated conversation
examples: The buzzing bees moved busily between the flowering plants
A buzzing mosquito kept everyone awake all night long
The buzzing crowd awaited the celebrity's arrival eagerly tonight
The office was buzzing with rumors about the merger

definitions: belonging to an earlier time that has now passed away
examples: The museum displays artifacts from bygone eras of history
She yearned for the bygone days of her youth
Those bygone traditions no longer fit modern society's values
The bygone era of steam trains holds romantic appeal

definitions: relating to surgical delivery of a baby through the abdomen
examples: The caesarean section was necessary for the baby's safety
Caesarean delivery rates have increased significantly in recent decades
Her caesarean scar healed well after proper medical care
The caesarean procedure took less than an hour total

definitions: carefully planned or intended to achieve a specific purpose
determined by mathematical computation or systematic analysis
examples: Her calculated risk paid off with enormous business profits
The calculated insult was designed to provoke a response
The calculated trajectory ensured the satellite's proper orbit position
Scientists calculated the precise distance between the two stars

definitions: deliberately scheming for personal advantage without regard for others
engaged in or capable of performing mathematical or logical calculations
examples: Her calculating nature made genuine friendships nearly impossible
The calculating politician manipulated every situation for personal gain
The calculating machine processed thousands of equations per second
Modern calculating systems handle complex mathematical operations effortlessly

definitions: adjusted to a standard scale for accurate measurement
carefully adjusted or modified to achieve a desired effect
examples: The calibrated instruments provided accurate temperature readings consistently
Each calibrated scale was checked against international standards
Her calibrated response balanced diplomacy with firm boundaries perfectly
The calibrated approach to reform avoided major disruptions entirely

definitions: having patches of different colors, especially in animals
made from or resembling calico cotton fabric with printed patterns
examples: The calico cat had patches of orange, black, and white
A calico horse grazed peacefully in the meadow
Her calico dress featured a cheerful floral print design
The calico curtains gave the room a country cottage feel

definitions: fresh, cool, or refreshing, especially used in Scottish dialect
examples: The caller breeze from the loch refreshed the tired hikers
We enjoyed caller oysters straight from the morning catch
The caller morning air invigorated everyone on the mountain trail
Nothing beats caller water from a Highland spring

definitions: relating to or characteristic of beautiful decorative handwriting as art
examples: The calligraphic invitation impressed all the wedding guests immensely
Her calligraphic style showed years of dedicated practice clearly
The calligraphic strokes in the painting added elegant detail
Ancient calligraphic manuscripts are preserved in the museum collection

definitions: showing cruel disregard for others' feelings or suffering
having skin that has become thick and hard from repeated friction
examples: His callous remarks about poverty shocked everyone at dinner
The callous treatment of workers led to massive strikes
Years of manual labor left his hands callous and rough
Her callous feet could walk on hot sand comfortably

definitions: lacking adult experience, wisdom, or sophistication; immature and naive
examples: The callow youth had much to learn about real hardship
His callow attempts at flirting only embarrassed everyone present
The callow recruits struggled with basic military discipline initially
Her callow understanding of politics showed in every debate

definitions: peaceful, quiet, and without worry, violence, or extreme movement
not showing or feeling nervousness, anger, or strong emotion
without wind or with very little wind movement
examples: The calm lake reflected the mountains like a mirror
After the storm passed, everything became beautifully calm again
She remained calm despite the emergency situation around her
His calm demeanor helped reassure the frightened children immediately
The calm weather made perfect conditions for sailing today
Sailors fear calm seas as much as violent storms

definitions: relating to calories or the energy value of food
relating to or producing heat energy in physical processes
examples: The caloric content of fast food often surprises people
Athletes need higher caloric intake than sedentary individuals daily
The caloric theory of heat was eventually replaced by thermodynamics
Caloric energy conversion drives many industrial processes today

definitions: disguised with colors or patterns to blend with surroundings
concealed or obscured to prevent detection or recognition
examples: The camouflaged soldiers were nearly invisible in the forest
Camouflaged hunting gear helps hunters remain undetected by prey
The camouflaged entrance to the bunker fooled enemy forces
Her true intentions were camouflaged behind friendly conversation

definitions: deliberately exaggerated, theatrical, or effeminate in an amusing way
relating to or used for camping or temporary outdoor living
examples: His camp performance delighted the audience with outrageous humor
The camp decorations at the party were intentionally over-the-top
We need camp supplies before heading into the wilderness
The camp stove worked perfectly for cooking outdoors

definitions: characterized by deliberate, humorous exaggeration or theatrical artificiality
examples: The campy horror movie became a cult classic instantly
Her campy sense of humor made every conversation entertaining
The campy decorations perfectly suited the retro theme party
They loved the campy melodrama of old soap operas

definitions: having a bright yellow color like a canary bird's feathers
examples: She wore a canary dress to the summer garden party
The canary walls brightened the previously dark room considerably
His canary sports car stood out in the parking lot
The canary paint made the kitchen feel warm and cheerful

definitions: called off, terminated, or decided not to happen as planned
marked to show that something is no longer valid or usable
examples: The cancelled flight left hundreds of passengers stranded overnight
All cancelled appointments must be rescheduled within two weeks
The cancelled check served as proof of payment made
Her cancelled passport prevented international travel until renewed

definitions: containing or affected by cancer cells that grow uncontrollably
spreading harmfully and destructively through a system or organization
examples: The cancerous tumor required immediate surgical removal for survival
Cancerous cells had spread to several organs before detection
The cancerous corruption spread throughout the entire government system
His cancerous influence poisoned the company's ethical culture completely

definitions: truthful and straightforward in speech; frank and sincere
taken informally without the subject's knowledge or posed preparation
examples: Her candid assessment of the situation surprised everyone present
I appreciate your candid feedback about my performance review
The candid photographs captured genuine emotions at the wedding
The photographer specialized in candid street photography scenes daily

definitions: relating to or characteristic of dogs or the dog family
relating to the pointed teeth between incisors and premolars
examples: The canine behavior expert trained aggressive dogs successfully
Canine companions provide emotional support for many people
Her canine teeth were unusually sharp and prominent naturally
The dentist examined the damaged canine tooth carefully today

definitions: preserved and sealed in metal containers for long-term storage
prepared in advance and repeated without variation or spontaneity
examples: The canned vegetables lasted for years in the pantry
Many people prefer fresh fruit over canned alternatives
His canned response didn't address our specific concerns adequately
The politician gave the same canned speech everywhere repeatedly

definitions: relating to or practicing the eating of one's own species
destructively competing within the same group or organization
examples: Some spider species display cannibalistic behavior after mating
The cannibalistic tribe's practices horrified early explorers completely
The company's cannibalistic pricing strategy hurt all competitors equally
Their cannibalistic business model destroyed the entire industry

definitions: having good judgment especially in money or business matters
examples: The canny investor avoided the market crash by selling early
Her canny business sense made her incredibly wealthy quickly
His canny observations about human nature impressed everyone greatly
The canny old farmer knew exactly when rain would come

definitions: accepted as being accurate, authoritative, and worthy of trust
conforming to general rules, standards, or recognized principles
examples: The canonical texts form the foundation of religious study
This canonical interpretation has been accepted for centuries now
The canonical form of the equation simplifies complex calculations
Scientists follow canonical procedures to ensure reproducible results

definitions: officially declared to be a saint by religious authority
treated as being above criticism or of great importance
examples: The canonised saint's feast day is celebrated annually worldwide
Many canonised martyrs died defending their religious beliefs courageously
His canonised status in literature remains largely unchallenged today
The canonised works are taught in every university program

definitions: officially declared to be a saint by religious authority
treated as being above criticism or of great importance
examples: The canonized saint attracts thousands of pilgrims each year
Several canonized figures played crucial roles in church history
These canonized principles guide all modern scientific research today
His canonized reputation makes any criticism seem like heresy

definitions: bad-tempered, argumentative, and uncooperative in a stubborn way
examples: The cantankerous old man complained about everything constantly
Her cantankerous mood made family dinner extremely unpleasant tonight
The cantankerous customer demanded to see three different managers
Even simple requests triggered his cantankerous responses immediately

definitions: positioned at an angle rather than straight or level
having a sloping or slanted surface rather than flat
examples: The canted roof allowed rain to drain off easily
Pictures hung at canted angles created an unsettling gallery effect
The canted walls of the modern building challenged conventional architecture
A canted edge on the blade improved its cutting efficiency

definitions: having the ability, fitness, or quality necessary to do something
competent and able to achieve things efficiently and successfully
examples: She's capable of solving complex mathematical problems easily
The new engine is capable of reaching incredible speeds
The capable assistant managed the entire office single-handedly yesterday
We need capable leaders to guide us through challenges

definitions: extremely thin or fine like a hair strand
relating to the smallest blood vessels in the body
examples: The capillary tubes were barely visible without magnification equipment
Capillary cracks in the wall indicated structural problems developing
Capillary action draws water up through plant stems naturally
The capillary network delivers oxygen to every body cell

definitions: of primary importance; principal or chief in significance
involving or punishable by death as legal punishment
excellent or first-rate in quality
examples: Honesty remains a capital virtue in all business dealings
The capital city attracts millions of tourists every year
Murder was once a capital offense in every state
The jury must decide on capital punishment very carefully
That's a capital idea for solving our problem efficiently
We had a capital time at the celebration yesterday

definitions: supporting or based on the economic system of capitalism
having wealth from business ownership and seeking profit
examples: The capitalist economy encourages private business ownership strongly
Capitalist principles dominated the country's economic policies completely
The capitalist investors sought maximum returns on their investments
Several capitalist entrepreneurs funded the new technology startup

definitions: showing the characteristics or principles of the capitalist economic system
examples: Their capitalistic approach prioritized profits over employee welfare
The capitalistic model encouraged fierce competition between companies
These capitalistic values shaped the nation's development profoundly
The capitalistic structure favored those with existing wealth

definitions: covered or furnished with a cap or top covering
having an upper limit that cannot be exceeded
examples: The capped bottles prevented any contamination during storage
Snow capped mountains surrounded the peaceful valley below
The capped interest rate protected borrowers from sudden increases
Employee bonuses were capped at ten percent of salary

definitions: given to sudden and unaccountable changes of mood or behavior
examples: The capricious weather ruined our carefully planned outdoor wedding
Her capricious decisions made project planning nearly impossible
The capricious boss changed company policies without warning constantly
Stock markets can be capricious and difficult to predict
